content.text:
Ce jeux vidéo est une fiction qui s’ancre dans 
la réalité en rendant compte de la numérisation 
au travers de documents réels indiqués 
par une disquette de sauvegarde.

Préserver le Passé 
Façonner  le Futur

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_pc.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to check the cursor movement (still or moving).
description: * The cursor has stayed still for a given duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor has stayed still for the specified time on the default layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CursorStayStill
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cursor has stayed still for _PARAM1_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is moving on the default layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CursorIsMoving

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraZoom
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows to zoom camera on a layer with a speed (factor per second).
description: This extension allows to zoom a camera on a layer at a given speed. The zoom speed is configurable and allows a constant as well as a variable zoom speed. An anchor point can be defined, for instance, to keep what is under the cursor at the same place on screen.
- Change the zoom with an anchor point
- Zoom at a given speed and with an anchor point

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeed

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change camera zoom to: _PARAM1_ with an anchor at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

events.comment:
When zooming the vector in pixels from the center to the anchor must stay the same.
It gives this system:

/ pixel_delta(t-1) = (anchor - center(t-1)) * zoom(t-1)
| pixel_delta(t) = (anchor - center(t)) * zoom(t)
\ pixel_delta(t) = pixel_delta(t-1)

where the new center can be resolved to:

center(t) = anchor + (center(t-1) - anchor) * zoom(t-1) / zoom(t)

parameters:
AnchorX
+ (
   CameraX(Layer, Camera)
   - AnchorX
)
* CameraZoom(Layer, Camera)
/ Zoom

AnchorY
+ (
   CameraY(Layer, Camera)
   - AnchorY
)
* CameraZoom(Layer, Camera)
/ Zoom

parameters.longDescription: 1: Initial zoom, 2: zoom in x2, 0.5: zoom out x2...
parameters.name: Zoom

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second) and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Zoom camera with speed and anchor
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeedAndAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Zoom camera with speed: _PARAM1_ and an anchror at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.
description: This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

inlineCode: Get the object layer, convert the position from this layer to the screen coordinates.
Get the point on each side on the object on screen, and compare with the screen area.
This way even if the camera has a rotation or custom scale the object is always compared to the screen area.
// Get the layer of the object.
// Get the aabb of the object on his layer.
// Get the layer to convert the coordinates of the AABB to the screen coordinates
// Get the points on each side of the object on screen.
const posLeftObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posRightObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[0], topRight[0], bottomLeft[0], bottomRight[0]);
const posUpObjectOnScreen = Math.min(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);
const posDownObjectOnScreen = Math.max(topLeft[1], topRight[1], bottomLeft[1], bottomRight[1]);

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.

eventsFunctions.description: Do change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: DoChangeCursorType

events.comment: Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: CursorType

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Turn any object into a cursor.
description: This extension allows to replace the cursor with an object.

- The button behavior has been removed. The button object can be used instead. Some ready to use buttons can be downloaded from the [Buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons) of the asset store.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turn any object into a mouse cursor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: cursor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: JSONResourceLoader
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Loads a JSON resource into a variable.
description: Loads a (static) JSON resource from your project files into a global, scene, or object variable.
NEVER use this to load your game.json into a variable - this would increase your game size by a lot and make your whole project file available for anyone to open!

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into a scene structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a scene variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToScene

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The scene variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in a global variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToGlobal

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The global variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctions.description: Loads a JSON resource into an object structure variable.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Load a JSON resource in an object variable
eventsFunctions.name: LoadJSONToObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load _PARAM1_ into object variable _PARAM3_ of object _PARAM2_

parameters.description: The resource to load the JSON from
parameters.name: Resource

parameters.description: The object where to find the variable
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: The object variable to load the JSON to
parameters.name: Variable

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMasking
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use a sprite or a shape painter to mask another object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: When masked, the masked object is only visible through the mask.

parameters.name: Mask
